preqs: If students are enrolled in course B6002, 0503 or 4401 there are no prerequisites.For students enrolled in other courses, the prerequisite is ACF5904 or ACF5958.

rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {0503, 4401, B6002} Do Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ACF5904, ACF5958} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} Otherwise true
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AFX5330, BUS5700, FIT5101}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {AFX5330, BUS5700, FIT5101}

description: The objective of this unit is to introduce students to the business aspects of integrated enterprise systems. Enterprise systems are configurable business information systems that integrate information across multiple enterprise functions and business units, support key enterprise processes, and provide an enterprise wide view of business performance. Topics include systems and technology background, business processes and process reengineering, integration of core financial and logistics processes, enterprise wide reporting, and techniques for assessing enterprise productivity and enterprise dynamics. A well-known integrated enterprise system will be extensively used in this unit.
